job_description: CBU SOFTWARE ENGINEER Co-OpDivision: Carrier Business UnitLocation: Burnaby, BCAPPLY WITH RESUME AND TRANSCRIPT TO JOB #1089215001We are looking for an energetic and self-motivated engineer co-op to work with our embedded software design/verification team.   Our focus is on teamwork, collaboration, and continuous improvements in an open and encouraging environment.  If you have a strong technical interest and experience in embedded software/firmware then this is the position for you!As a Software Engineer Co-op, you will be part of a team of professionals developing and testing software/firmware drivers for modern System-on-Chip (SoC) wireline infrastructure devices.  You will gain hands-on experience with the development tools used for developing, debugging and testing the software driver.  In addition, you will have exposure to existing and new communications protocols, including Ethernet and OTN.ResponsibilitiesReporting into the Communication Products Division Software Development/Test Team, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:• Design, develop, integrate, debug, and verify software components• Perform unit testing, system-level and regression testing for the software/firmware.• Port software code from existing device to the next generation device.  • Maintain and automate regular build processes and regression with our CI system• Setup and configuration of 3rd party test equipment and PMC test boards for SW verification• Work with the hardware and validation teams as part of the development activities.
job_requirements: Qualifications• You have previous co-op experience, preferably in the areas of embedded software/firmware development and testing. • You have experience with C and (optionally) Assembly coding.• You have experience with scripting languages like Tcl and Python.• You have experience in defining test cases and test automation.• You have excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills.• You have a systematic approach to problem-solving within a team and on your own.• You are enrolled in 3rd or 4th year of an Electrical Engineering and / or Computer Science program (or equivalent); CGPA > 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (or equivalent)• Preferably, you have understanding of microprocessor architecture fundamentals.• Preferably, you have understanding of real-time embedded systems fundamentals.Open To All Majors:No
